required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility of Gamma Transcranial Alternating Current Stimulation to Reduce Beta-amyloid Load and Improve Memory
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility of Gamma Transcranial Alternating Current Stimulation to Reduce Beta-amyloid Load and Improve Memory

brief_summary.textblock: This project will assess the feasibility of transcranial alternating current stimulation in the gamma band to lower beta-amyloid load and improve memory performance.

primary_outcome.description: 12 side effects will be measured on a scale from 0 (not noticable) to 10 (not tolerable): headache, neck pain, scalp pain, tingling, itching, burning sensation, increased sleepiness, trouble concentrating, acute mood change, phosphenes, back pain, dizziness.
Drop out rate will be assessed as the number of participants who withdraw or are withdrawn from the study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-tACS (baseline), post-tACS (after one month of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in plasma beta amyloid load will be assessed pre and post intervention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-tACS (baseline), post-tACS (after one month of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in episodic memory will be assessed pre and post intervention as accuracy for word lists from the California Verbal Learning Test.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-tACS (baseline), post-tACS (after one month of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in episodic memory will be assessed pre and post intervention from memory accuracy for a paired associates task.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-tACS (baseline), post-tACS (after one month of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in episodic memory will be assessed pre and post intervention from performance on the FAS task.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-tACS (baseline), post-tACS (after one month of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in plasma tau levels will be assessed pre and post intervention.

other_outcome.description: RSFC will be assessed as a predictor of tACS effects. Modularity will be calculated and used in a regression model.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Resting state functional connectivity (RSFC)
other_outcome.time_frame: pre-tACS (baseline), post-tACS (after one month of treatment)
other_outcome.description: Change in RSFC will be assessed pre and post intervention.
MRS will be assessed as a predictor of tACS effects. The ratio of excitatory (GLX+) to inhibitory (GABA) neurotransmitters will be used in a regression model.

other_outcome.time_frame: pre-tACS (baseline), post-tACS (after one month of treatment)
other_outcome.description: Change in MRS will be assessed pre and post intervention.
EF will be assessed as a predictor of tACS effects. EF magnitude will be calculated from T1 and T2 images, and used in a regression model.

other_outcome.time_frame: pre-tACS (baseline), post-tACS (after one month of treatment)
other_outcome.description: Change in IADL will be assessed pre and post intervention.

other_outcome.time_frame: pre-tACS (baseline), post-tACS (after one month of treatment)
other_outcome.description: Change in blood neurofilament light levels will be assessed pre and post intervention.

other_outcome.time_frame: pre-tACS (baseline), post-tACS (after one month of treatment)
other_outcome.description: Change in blood neurogranin levels will be assessed pre and post intervention.

arm_group.description: This group will receive gamma stimulation

intervention.description: Transcranial alternating current stimulation (tACS) will be applied at 40 Hz (gamma band) during eight sessions over the course of a month.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- English speaking
- Grade 12 or more education
- Normal or corrected to normal vision and hearing
- Ability to complete cognitive tasks
- Ability to cooperate and comply with all study procedures
- Ability to tolerate tACS
- Self-reported memory complaint
- Diagnosed with mild cognitive impairment
- Amyloid positive
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neurological or psychiatric disorders other than mild cognitive impairment
- Receiving investigational medications or have participated in a trial with investigational medications within last 30 days
- Family history of epilepsy
- Implanted electronic devices (e.g., pacemaker)
- Prior head trauma
- Pregnant
- IQ < 80
- Taking cholinesterase inhibitory, memantine, or psychotropic medication
- Taking anti-depressants or anti-anxiety medication
- Color blind
- Substance abuse
- Glaucoma
- Macular degeneration
- Amblyopia (lazy eye)
- Strabismus (crossed eyes)

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized IPD will be shared in accordance with NIH guidelines and IRB approval.
